preference.name: ITEM_first_rev_id
preference.preference_description: Enables item revision ID sequencing. This preference is the default site preference that is used for all item types. To apply a different revision sequencing format to a particular item type, a site preference must be defined for the item type.

preference.name: Envelope.RENDERING
preference.preference_description: To register Envelope Stylesheet.

preference.name: EnvelopeProperty.REGISTEREDTO
preference.preference_description: To register Envelope Stylesheet.

preference.name: Envelope.SUMMARYRENDERING
preference.preference_description: To register Envelope summary Stylesheet.

preference.name: EnvelopeSummary.SUMMARY_REGISTEREDTO
preference.preference_description: To register Envelope summary Stylesheet.

preference.name: PS_new_seqno_mode
preference.preference_description: Controls how the find number is generated for new occurrences. Valid values are: * "new": new numbers are allocated to each of the occurrences. * "existing": new numbers are only allocated for occurrences of unique items. * "none": no numbers are generated.

preference.name: UGMASTER_saveas_pattern
preference.preference_description: Defines the pattern string of the name of new UGMASTER dataset object during a "Save As" operation. Value may contain text and also refer to the content of some of the object's properties using the ${PropertyName} format, with PropertyName being ItemID, RevisionID or UserText. Existing dataset name is expected to match this pattern. If the existing dataset name does not match the pattern, then the new dataset name will not follow this pattern. Example: ${UserText}-${ItemID}/${RevisionID} where the site has decided that the ${UserText} at the beginning is intended to be the name of the dataset, and the minus sign is literal text. Suppose a user is saving item revision 001234/B to item revision 002345/A. If a dataset's existing name is "master-001234/B" then the name is said to 'match' against the pattern. Since the ${UserText} at the start of this pattern matches any string, dataset name "fea-001234/B" would also match against the pattern. However, "master_001234/B" would not match the pattern as the minus sign is required, and "master-001235/B" would not match since the ItemID is incorrect. Once an original dataset name has been matched against the pattern, the new dataset name is generated by replacing the ${ItemID} and ${RevisionID} with the new revision and ItemID in the pattern, and all occurrences of ${UserData} with whatever text they matched against in the original name. This new name can then be used for saving the new dataset. Using the example above, the dataset would be saved as "master-002345/A". This is a site preference.

preference.name: TC_ugmaster_name_separator
preference.preference_description: Defines the separator used for ugmaster objects names at creation time. This is a site preference.

preference.name: TC_show_open_in_nx_button
preference.preference_description: Specifies if the "Open in NX" button should be displayed in the Teamcenter Rich Client. Valid values are true/false. true - Displays the button. false - Does not display the button.

preference.name: LOV_value_desc_separator
preference.preference_description: Defines the character to separate LOV values from their descriptions

preference.name: EPM_resource_pool_recipients
preference.preference_description: This preference is used by notfication handlers for filtering resource pool members. The valid values are "all","subscribed","none" (without double quotes)

preference.name: GroupMember_ColumnPreferences
preference.preference_description: Description not provided during import.

preference.name: GroupMember_ColumnWidthPreferences
preference.preference_description: Description not provided during import.

preference.name: Fnd0WorkflowAudit_ColumnPreferences
preference.preference_description: Specifies the list of columns to be displayed on Process History Table for objects of type Fnd0WorkflowAudit.

preference.name: Fnd0WorkflowAudit_ColumnWidthPreferences
preference.preference_description: Specifies the widths (in pixels) of the columns specified by the preference "Fnd0WorkflowAudit_ColumnPreferences".

preference.name: EPMTask.SUMMARYRENDERING
preference.preference_description: Registration of summary stylesheet for EPMTask objects.

preference.name: BaseEPMTaskSummary.SUMMARY_REGISTEREDTO
preference.preference_description: Indicates the type to which the BaseEPMTaskSummary summary stylesheet can be applied.

preference.name: Dataset.SUMMARYRENDERING
preference.preference_description: Registration of summary stylesheet for Dataset objects.

preference.name: DatasetSummary.SUMMARY_REGISTEREDTO
preference.preference_description: Indicates the types to which the Dataset summary stylesheet can be applied.

preference.name: TC_Project.SUMMARYRENDERING
preference.preference_description: Registration of summary stylesheet for TC_Project objects.

preference.name: ProjectSummary.SUMMARY_REGISTEREDTO
preference.preference_description: Indicates the type to which the TC_Project summary stylesheet can be applied.

preference.name: Item_DefaultChildProperties
preference.preference_description: List of properties that can be used as children for the indicated type i.e. Item. The format of the preference follows: <TypeName>_DefaultChildProperties=my_property. For proxy link integration, add external_apps to this list.

preference.name: DATASET_saveas_pattern
preference.preference_description: Specifies the pattern string consisting of literal text and the following tokens: ${UserText}, ${ItemID} and ${RevisionID}. Existing dataset names are expected to match this pattern, where ${ItemID} and ${RevisionID} match the item id and revision id of the owning item revision respectively, and ${UserText} matches any text in the original name. If the existing dataset names do not match the pattern, then the new dataset names will not follow this pattern. Example: ${UserText}-${ItemID}/${RevisionID} where the site has decided that the ${UserText} at the beginning is intended to be the name of the dataset, and the minus sign is literal text. Suppose a user is saving item revision 001234/B to item revision 002345/A. If a dataset's existing name is "drawing-001234/B" then the name is said to 'match' against the pattern. Since the ${UserText} at the start of this pattern matches any string, dataset name "fea-001234/B" would also match against the pattern. However, "drawing_001234/B" would not match the pattern as the minus sign is required, and "drawing-001235/B" would not match since the ItemID is incorrect. Once an original dataset name has been matched against the pattern, the new dataset name is generated by replacing the ${ItemID} and ${RevisionID} with the new revision and ItemID in the pattern, and all occurrences of ${UserData} with whatever text they matched against in the original name. This new name can then be used for saving the new dataset. Using the example above, the two datasets would be saved as "drawing-002345/A" and "fea-002345/A". According to preference DATASET_saveas_allow_name_modification, the user may be allowed to modify these generated names. However, if DATASET_saveas_force_name_validation is true, the user-edited name is still required to match the pattern. The preferences DATASET_saveas_pattern, DATASET_saveas_allow_name_modification, DATASET_saveas_force_name_validation, DATASET_saveas_always_copy, DATASET_saveas_never_copy, DATASET_saveas_owner, DATASET_saveas_allow_duplicates are currently only used by USER_copied_datasets_details and USER_copied_dataset_name, and these are only currently called by NXManager Unigraphics.

preference.name: DirectModel_saveas_pattern
preference.preference_description: Specifies the pattern string consisting of literal text and the following tokens: ${UserText}, ${ItemID} and ${RevisionID}. Existi ng dataset names are expected to match this pattern, where ${ItemID} and ${RevisionID} match the item id and revision id of the owning item revision respectively, and ${UserText} matches any text in the original name. Example: ${UserText}-${ItemID}/${RevisionID} where the site has decided that the ${UserText} at the beginning is intended to be the name of the dataset, and the minus sign is literal text. Suppose a user is saving item revision 001234/B to item revision 002345/A. If a dataset's existing name is "drawing-001234/B" then the name is said to 'match' against the pattern. Since the ${UserText} at the start of this pattern matches any string, dataset name "fea-001234/B" would also match against the pattern. However, drawing_001234/B would not match the pattern as the minus sign is required, and drawing-001235/B would not match since the ItemID is incorrect. Once an original dataset name has been matched against the pattern, the new dataset name is generated by replacing the ${ItemID} and ${RevisionID} with the new revision and ItemID in the pattern, and all occurrences of ${UserData} with whatever text they matched against in the original name. This new name can then be used for saving the new dataset. Using the example above, the two datasets would be saved as drawing-002345/A and fea-002345/A. According to preference DATASET_saveas_allow_name_modification, the user may be allowed to modify these generated names. However, if DATASET_saveas_force_name_validation is true, the user-edited name is still required to match the pattern. The preferences DATASET_saveas_pattern, DATASET_saveas_allow_name_modification, DATASET_saveas_force_name_validation, DATASET_saveas_always_copy, DATASET_saveas_never_copy, DATASET_saveas_owner, DATASET_saveas_allow_duplicates are currently only used by USER_copied_datasets_details and USER_copied_dataset_name, and these are only currently called by NXManager Unigraphics.

preference.name: TC_NX_Foreign_Datasets
preference.preference_description: Specifies the non-NX dataset types available to NX when it lists the datasets in an Item Revision. The value format is four keywords (DatasetType, NamedReference, NamedReferenceFormat, NamedReferenceTemplate) and their values (enclosed in double quotation marks). The format informs NX precisely which named references of the dataset contain the CAD data. Valid values for the "NamedReferenceFormat" keyword are "BINARY" or "TEXT". Valid values for the "NamedReferenceTemplate" keyword are the extension for files of that type. The values are case sensitive, and each value refers to a dataset type. Following are examples for values: DatasetType="DirectModel" NamedReference="JTPART" NamedReferenceFormat="BINARY" NamedReferenceTemplate="jt" DatasetType="SE PART" NamedReference="SE-Part" NamedReferenceFormat="BINARY" NamedReferenceTemplate="par"

preference.name: WSOM_find_set_pff_displaydata_limit
preference.preference_description: Limits the number of objects to be loaded when clicking the "Load All" button in the display data of search results view. Giving a higher number (above 1000) significantly slows the system response.

preference.name: TC_Auto_Checkout
preference.preference_description: If this preference is ON, non-NX datasets will be automatically Checked-Out when a user opens that dataset. This will prevent another user from gaining write access to this dataset until the first user closes the dataset.

preference.name: TC_show_checkedout_icon
preference.preference_description: Enables the display of the checked-out icon in BOM trees, Attachment trees, Activity trees and Occurrence Group trees.

preference.name: TC_Project.RENDERING
preference.preference_description: Registration of stylesheet for TC_Project objects.

preference.name: TC_Project.REGISTEREDTO
preference.preference_description: Indicates the types to which the TC_Project stylesheet can be applied.

preference.name: Design Revision_DefaultChildProperties
preference.preference_description: Specifies the list of properties that can be displayed as children of a Design Revision node.

preference.name: Design Revision_PseudoFolder
preference.preference_description: Specifies the list of properties that can be displayed as a pseudo-folder under a node for Design Revision object.

preference.name: TC_audit_number_of_logs_to_load
preference.preference_description: Specifies the maximum number of audit records to be displayed.

preference.name: TC_allow_inherited_group_volume_access
preference.preference_description: No description available for this preference.

preference.name: TC_show_checkout_objects_on_exit
preference.preference_description: Indicates if the dialog "Find Checked Out Objects" should be displayed when exiting Teamcenter. Valid values are "TRUE" or "FALSE".

preference.name: BOM_Enable_Ref_Designator_Value_Packing
preference.preference_description: Turns on and off the packing of Reference Designator values for packed bomlines. If it is turned off, the reference designator value of the master line of the packed lines will be displayed. If it is turned on, all reference designator values of packed lines will be packed. For example, if reference designator values of the packed lines are: C1, C2, C3, C7, C100, C101, the display value of reference designator of the packed line is C1-C3,C7,C100-C101. Valid values are true or false.

preference.name: TC_BOM_Precision_Preference
preference.preference_description: Specifies the BOM precision to be used during the creation of new BOMViews/BOMViewRevisions. Valid values are Precise/Imprecise.

preference.name: TC_config_rule_name
preference.preference_description: Indicates the default config rule that will be used when opening/printing Imprecise BOMView or BOMViewRevisions. If this rule does not exist, the system will default to "Latest Working".

preference.name: PSEAutoPackPref
preference.preference_description: Indicates if the PSE display needs to be packed by default. Valid values are 0/1. 0 - Do not pack. 1 - Pack PSE by default.

preference.name: PSESubstituteColorPref
preference.preference_description: Specifies the color to be used when displaying a substitute BOM Line in Structure Manager. The value can be: * a standard supported string: "black", "white", "lightGray", "gray", "darkGray", "red", "pink", "orange", "yellow", "green", "magenta", "cyan" and "blue". * a hexadecimal number (e.g. "#50b080" which represents "Sea Green"). The default value is "#a0b6c0", which represents "lightGray".

preference.name: Baseline_consider_all_statuses
preference.preference_description: Activates considering all release statuses attached to Item Revisions, while creating baselines for released Item Revisions. Valid values are: * false: Only the latest release status on Item Revisions is considered. * true: All release statuses present on Item Revisions are considered.

preference.name: CR_allow_alternate_procedures
preference.preference_description:
Manages the visibility of workflow templates in the "New Process" panel of the Workflow application in the rich client. Valid values are: * any : The "All" option is pre-selected in the "All/Assigned" radio button group, which means that all templates are listed. * Assigned: The "Assigned" option is pre-selected in the "All/Assigned" radio button group, which means that only the templates assigned to the group and selected target object type are listed. * none: The options "All/Assigned" are not visible. Furthermore, only the templates assigned to the group and selected target object type are displayed (behaviour similar to the "Assigned" option). When no templates are assigned for the target group/type, the displayed list is empty. If no object was selected when initiating the workflow, all the templates assigned to the group are listed. This is the default value.
Process templates assigned to a group and a target object type are defined through the "Process designer->Edit->Template Filter" command.

preference.name: EPM_resource_pool_restrict_subscription
preference.preference_description: Restricts the resource pools available for subscription based on user membership in the "Resource Pool Subscription" dialog. Valid values are: ON - the user can subscribe only to groups and roles for which he/she is a member. OFF - the users can subscribe to all groups and roles. This is the default value.

preference.name: SIGNOFF_adhoc_quorum
preference.preference_description:
Indicates if the task quorum modifiable by Teamcenter user in select-signoff-team can be set lower than that defined by the task template when adhoc signoffs functionality is enabled (EPM_adhoc_signoffs=ON). Valid values are 1/2. 1 - User can set signoff quorum value either less than or greater than that set by task template. 2 - User can set signoff quorum value only greater that that set by task template.
NOTE: For setting 2, if the signoff-quorum is set as -1 (ALL), in that case, the user cannot modify the signoff quorum through select-signoff-team task.
This is a site preference.

preference.name: EPM_multiple_processes_targets
preference.preference_description: Enables/Disables multiple processes for same objects in the Workflow application. Valid values are: * ON: Enables Multiple processes. This is the default value. * OFF: Disables Multiple processes.

preference.name: EPM_notify_url_format
preference.preference_description: Defines the type of client connection for URL generation by notify and CR-notify handlers. The valid values are "rich", "dhtml", "activeworkspace" and "none".

preference.name: WRKFLW_modify_target_list_access_privilege
preference.preference_description: Indicates the access privilege to be used in order to enforce permission on modification of the Workflow target list. Valid values are any access privilege. The default value is the CHANGE access privilege.

preference.name: WRKFLW_use_legacy_template_filter
preference.preference_description: Indicates whether to use the legacy Type and Group based Template Filter or the new Condition based Template Filter. Valid values are: * true: Use the legacy Type and Group based Template Filter. * false: Use the new Condition based Template Filter. This is the default value.
